content: hello jams.com my name is cassidy and
i'm here to talk to you about what's latest and greatest in next.js world
well nextjs just came out with next 9.5 about
two three months ago and it is a really cool update and honestly the updates
since march have been really game-changing and i've been
really loving their effort to go more towards static and kind of embrace
the jam stack and all sorts of things and and i think it's just
a really neat framework to play around with one of my favorite features that
came out is react fast refresh now if you're not sure what that is
it looks a lot like regular hot reloading where you can
update your code and then it reloads the page and that's it
but it's a little bit different and the reason why it's different is because it
actually maintains the state of your application
as you're coding on it and so let's just say very simple example
i have some kind of counter and i toggle the counter to click
all the way up to five and then i want to change the style of it when it hits
five i can change that style but then
typically with hot reloading i would then have to go back as my page
has refreshed because i've updated something then
click up to five again you don't have to do that with fast refresh it actually
maintains the state of your application as you're updating things
now a counter is a very very simple example but if you think about
all of the really cool user interactions and things that you might want to
maintain authentications i don't even know api
calls all kinds of stuff that you would like
to keep on the page as you're updating things
it'll just stay there and the state will exist
and you can do all of your updates and have it just stay on the page and
i think that's really really powerful and kind of an underestimated and under
appreciated new feature of next js now there's so many cool things that you
can do with nexjs and it's no secret a lot of places don't actually support
all the new features because it's it's got so many new ones but we
have this really cool package at netlify called next on netlify and if you go to
our github you can find next on netlify and
a repo there and it's a really cool package that allows you to use all of
the server rendering sides of nexjs on nutlify and it uses netify functions
to run a bunch of different things you can make your own api
with next.js and next on netlify there's i can't even begin to explain all the
cool things that you can do with that package
so that being said if you are at all interested in next js
or using next on netlify go ahead and head over to our github and check out
that package there and we'll be pushing a lot of updates to it soon
and if you'd like to see any starter projects to get up and running with next
you can head over to my github and i have a bunch of neck starter
projects blogging projects cms projects where you can kind of
get up and running with it i hope you enjoyed the rest of the conference and
i'll talk to you later
bye you
